text:
The Election Commission on Monday issued notification for the third phase of West Bengal elections on April 21, starting the process of filing nominations in 62 constituencies in the State.

Around 23 nomination papers were filed on the first day on Monday, State’s Additional Chief Electoral Officer Dibyendu Sarkar said.

Voters of the 62 constituencies of Murshidabad (22), Nadia (17), Uttar Kolkata (7) and parts of Burdwan (16) would be able to exercise their franchise from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. in this phase.

Candidates contesting for this phase will be able to file their nominations up to April 4, while scrutiny of nomination papers will be held on April 5 and the date of withdrawal will end on April 7, he said.

For the Phase II elections on April 17, in seven districts of Alipurduar, Jalpaiguri, Uttar Dinajpur, Dakshin Dinajpur, Malda, Birbhum) 130 nominations were filed till Saturday, Mr. Sarkar said.

Of the 130, the BSP filed 25, BJP 11, CPI(M) 5, Congress 6, Trinamool Congress 17, Forward Bloc 3, RSP 1, Independents 11 and 51 by other registered parties till Saturday, he said. Tuesday is the last day for filing of nominations for the second phase. — PTI
title: Notification for third phase of Bengal polls
